Mattias, yes I remember when you were experimenting with color.  It is
cert=
ainly a difficult feature to implement.  The color system is
somewhat compl=
icated and the result of a lot of trial and error.  The
main principle that=
 we followed that probably helped was that we
wanted to be able to evolve c=
olor directly onto our existing black and
white images.  Hence, color outpu=
ts are a function of both the
existing black and white output (which we cal=
l "structure") and of
positional inputs, which allows colors to diverge fro=
m the pure b&w
structure over time.  I believe it is this relationship betw=
een color
and the underlying existing structure that is producing images th=
at
look sensible.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Mattias Fagerlund" <m=
attias@...> wrote:
>
> Could you describe how you represent color within pi=
cbreeder? I remember
> experimenting with at least three different methods,=
 finding none of
them
> satisfactory - but your method looks nice!
> 
> wit=
h regards,
> mattias
